result.execSummary:
The defendant Noelle Y. Kost was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Theft by Acquisition, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Oneida County Clerk of Circuit Court

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noelle Y. Kost

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notified Judy - appearance and extension granted

1:55 p.m. Defendant Noelle Y. Kost in court.  Court questions defendant as to payment. Defendant has $142.00 cash today. Defendant requests payment plan for balance. Court quashes warrant and orders defendant to Clerk of Court today to set-up payment plan, make first payment and balance of $142.00 applied to fine today.
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

03:36 pm - Defendant Noelle Y. Kost in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Schiek states defendant has made up front restitution payment.  Restitution is paid in full.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  State files Victim Impact statement.  Schiek/Burns/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
Court Costs $243/DNA Surcharge $200
Appeal rights given  Review hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

02:347 pm - Defendant Noelle Y. Kost in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns. Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement in place - calls for upfront restitution payment - request one more adjournment for defendant to come up with the restitution payment.  Court will grant adjournment.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

04:16 pm - Attorney Mary L.R. Burns in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Burns states will be appointed - Further states defendant is at doctor appointment in Appleton.  Court quashes warrant and adjourns.  Burns in receipt of complaint, waives reading and enters a not guilty plea.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
03:19 pm - Defendant Noelle Y. Kost not in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court authorizes warrant.

Defendant Noelle Y. Kost in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:58
Defendant thought someone from PD would be here today- has spoken to their office 3 times
Court statement - Court will adj to 3-16
Bail continued

  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

03:08 pm - Defendant Noelle Y. Kost not in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michlig states rec'd fax from the Family Health Center in Minocqua requesting defendant be excused from court appearance due to an injury.  Court adjourns.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

03:Defendant Noelle Y. Kost in court, in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 14tr2776 (BWI) - zero payments $200.50 still owing.   Warrants quashed based upon defendant's appearance.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD.  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Court questions defendant as to plan for paying off fine.  Defendant requests 30 days to pay.  Review Hearing Monday, March 16, 2015 @ 10 a.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Per Mary at ONSO - will be in custody shortly - doing a line meet with Vilas County
